intro: Galium boreale f. genuinum, commonly known as the northern bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of boreal and temperate ecosystems.
